log.input:
Simple Pendulum

If we define the moment of inertia (I) as:

$$
I = mr^2
$$

Since the torque $\tau$ and angular acceleration $\alpha$ are in opposite directions, their relationship is:

$$
\tau = -I\alpha \Rightarrow rF\sin\theta = -mr^2 \frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2} \Rightarrow \frac{F}{m}r\sin\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

If $r = L$ and $F = mg$, when $\theta < 5^\circ$, $\sin \theta \approx \theta$, then the equation can be rewritten as:

$$
\frac{g}{L}\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

From this, we can solve for:

$$
\theta(t) = \theta_0 \cos\left(\sqrt{\frac{g}{L}} t\right) = \theta_0 \cos(\omega t)
$$

In the equation above, $\omega$ is the angular frequency of the oscillation, therefore the period is:

$$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega} = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}
$$

Program to be written:

An ideal simple pendulum, change the initial swing angle to calculate the motion process and period.

The pendulum should swing back and forth naturally, starting from an initial angle and oscillating under the influence of gravity. The motion should follow the simple harmonic motion equation and not complete a full circle.

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Length_I as a cyber input variable, set Length_I=10
(2) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input variable, set Radius_I=1
(3) Length_I is the length of the pendulum. When Length_I changes to a new value, the length of the pendulm also changes to that value.
(4) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(5) Do not import packages that are not supported by VPython such as numpy, math and time
log.output:
from vpython import scene, vector, color, sphere, rate, cos, sqrt, pi

# Constants
g = 9.8
theta = 0.1

# Initialize varaibles
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create Pendulum
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I*cos(theta), -Length_I, 0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), axis=ball.pos, radius=0.01)

# Animation
omega = sqrt(g/Length_I)
T = 2*pi/omega
t = 0
dt = 0.01

while True:
    rate(100)
    theta = theta*cos(omega*t)
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*cos(theta), -Length_I, 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
    t += dt

from vpython import *

# Constants
g = 9.8
length = 10
angle = 30

# Create 3D objects
ceiling = box(pos=vec(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.white)
ball = sphere(pos=vec(length*sin(radians(angle)), -length*cos(radians(angle)), 0), radius=1, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.white)

# Create a loop to animate the pendulum
while True:
    rate(100)
    acc = -g*sin(ball.pos.x/length) / length
    ball.velocity += vec(acc, 0, 0)
    ball.pos += ball.velocity
    rod.axis = ball.pos - rod.pos
log.output:
from vpython import *

# Constants
g = 9.8
length = 10
angle = 30

# Create 3D objects
ceiling = box(pos=vec(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.white)
ball = sphere(pos=vec(length*sin(radians(angle)), -length*cos(radians(angle)), 0), radius=1, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.white)

# Initialize variables
ball.velocity = vec(0, 0, 0)

# Create a loop to animate the pendulum
while True:
    rate(100)
    acc = -g*sin(ball.pos.x/length) / length
    ball.velocity += vec(acc, 0, 0)
    ball.pos += ball.velocity * 0.01
    rod.axis = ball.pos - rod.pos

log.output:
from vpython import sphere, cylinder, vector, color, rate, box, sin, cos, radians, sqrt, pi

# Constants
g = 9.8 # gravity

# Initial conditions
Length_I = 10 # length of the pendulum
Radius_I = 1 # radius of the ball
theta = radians(30) # initial angle

# Create pendulum
ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.yellow)

# Time settings
dt = 0.01
t = 0
omega = sqrt(g/Length_I)

while True:
    rate(100) # limit the animation speed to 100 loops per second
    theta = theta*cos(omega*t) # update angle
    # Update pendulum position
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos-ceiling.pos
    t += dt

from vpython import sphere, cylinder, vector, color, rate, box, sin, cos, radians, sqrt, pi

# Constants
g = 9.8 # gravity

# Initial conditions
Length_I = 10 # length of the pendulum
Radius_I = 1 # radius of the ball
theta = radians(30) # initial angle

# Create pendulum
ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.yellow)

# Time settings
dt = 0.01
t = 0
omega = sqrt(g/Length_I)

while True:
    rate(100) # limit the animation speed to 100 loops per second
    theta = theta*cos(omega*t) # update angle
    # Update pendulum position
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos-ceiling.pos
    t += dt
log.output:
from vpython import sphere, cylinder, vector, color, rate, box, sin, cos, radians, sqrt, pi

# Constants
g = 9.8 # gravity

# Initial conditions
Length_I = 10 # length of the pendulum
Radius_I = 1 # radius of the ball
theta = radians(30) # initial angle

# Create pendulum
ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos, radius=0.01, color=color.yellow)

# Time settings
dt = 0.01
t = 0
omega = sqrt(g/Length_I)

while True:
    rate(100) # limit the animation speed to 100 loops per second
    theta += omega*dt # update angle
    # Update pendulum position
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos-ceiling.pos
    t += dt

from vpython import sphere, cylinder, vector, color, rate, cos, sin, sqrt, pi

# Constants
g = 9.8
theta = 0.1

# Initialize variables
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create Pendulum
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), axis=ball.pos, radius=0.01)

# Animation

T = 2*pi/omega

    theta = omega*t
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos

from vpython import sphere, cylinder, vector, color, rate, cos, sin, sqrt, pi

# Constants
g = 9.8
theta = 0.1

# Initialize variables
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create Pendulum
ball = sphere(pos=vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0), radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), axis=ball.pos, radius=0.01)

# Animation
omega = sqrt(g/Length_I)
T = 2*pi/omega
t = 0
dt = 0.01

while True:
    rate(100)
    theta = omega*t
    ball.pos = vector(Length_I*sin(theta), -Length_I*cos(theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
    t += dt
